r.from: University of WisconsinâMilwaukee School of Public Health

revisions.rev:
'''[[University of WisconsinâMilwaukee]]''' is a [[Doctorate|doctoral-degree]] granting public research university that consists of 14 colleges and schools, and 70 academic centers, institutes and laboratory facilities. It offers a total of 180 degree programs, including 94 [[Bachelor's degree|bachelor]]'s, 53 [[Master's degree|master]]'s and 32 [[doctorate]] degrees.<ref name=degrees>[http://www4.uwm.edu/future_students/general_information/degrees/], University of WisconsinâMilwaukee. Retrieved on October 13, 2009.</ref> The [[University of WisconsinâMilwaukee School of Freshwater Sciences|School of Freshwater Sciences]] is the only graduate school of freshwater science in the U.S. and the third in the world.<ref name="www4.uwm.edu">[http://www4.uwm.edu/acad_aff/newsevents/sfws_sph_established.cfm Schools of Freshwater Sciences and Public Health Established]</ref><ref name="jsonline.com">[http://www.jsonline.com/news/education/29429744.html A proposed UWM graduate school could make Milwaukee a global leader in freshwater research], Journal Sentinel</ref><ref name="nuwireinvestor.com">[http://www.nuwireinvestor.com/articles/american-midwest-a-growing-water-investment-hub-53712.aspx American Midwest: A Growing Center For Water Investment], NuWire Investor</ref> The [[University of WisconsinâMilwaukee School of Architecture and Urban Planning|School of Architecture and Urban Planning]], the [[University of WisconsinâMilwaukee College of Nursing|College of Nursing]] and the [[University of WisconsinâMilwaukee College of Health Sciences|College of Health Sciences]] are the largest in [[Wisconsin]].<ref name="ReferenceA">[http://www4.uwm.edu/nursing/about/dean_welcome.cfm http://www4.uwm.edu/nursing/about/dean_welcome.cfm]</ref><ref name="About CHS Facts & Figures">[http://www4.uwm.edu/chs/about_chs/inside.cfm About CHS Facts & Figures], University of WisconsinâMilwaukee</ref>
The university is categorized as an RU/H Research University (high research activity) in the [[Carnegie Classification of Institutions of Higher Education]].<ref>[http://classifications.carnegiefoundation.org/lookup_listings/view_institution.php?unit_id=240453&start_page=institution.php&clq=%7B%22first_letter%22%3A%22U%22%7D Carnegie Foundation for the Advancement of Teaching]</ref> Per ''[[US News & World Report]]'' 2011, the University is ranked 171st nationally by America's Best High School guidance counselors as offering the best undergraduate education to their students.<ref>[http://colleges.usnews.rankingsandreviews.com/best-colleges/rankings/national-universities/high-school-counselor/page+8 High School Counselor Rankings], ''[[US News & World Report]]'' 2011.</ref>

Lubar School of Business]] *[[University of WisconsinâMilwaukee School of Freshwater Sciences|School of Freshwater Sciences]] {{col-end}}

|[[Speech-Language Pathology]] |align="center" |72 |2008<ref>[http://grad-schools.usnews.rankingsandreviews.com/best-graduate-schools/top-pathology-schools/rankings/page+4 Speech-Language Pathology Ranking in 2008],''[[U.S. News & World Report]]''</ref> |} Based on the statistical analysis by H.J. Newton, Professor of Statistics at Texas A&M University in 1997 on the [[United States National Research Council|National Research Council]] report issued in 1995, the University of WisconsinâMilwaukee was ranked 72nd among public universities in the U.S. in the [[NRC Rankings]].<ref>[http://www.stat.tamu.edu/~jnewton/nrc_rankings/nrc1.html#PUBLIC A Brief Summary of the NRC Rankings], Texas A&M University</ref><ref>[http://www.nap.edu/readingroom.php?book=researchdoc&page=index.html ''Research-Doctorate Programs in the United States Continuity and Change''], National Research Council, National Academy of Sciences, Washington, D.C. 1995 </ref> It was also ranked among the top 100 universities in the U.S. by Vanguard College Ranking,<ref>[http://www.postmaterial.org/collegerankings/index.php Vanguard College Ranking.] Retrieved on June 22, 2008.</ref> 247th by ''[[Washington Monthly]]''<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.washingtonmonthly.com/college_guide/rankings/national_university_rank.php |title=College Guide: National University Rankings |year=2009 |publisher=''The Washington Monthly'' |accessdate=2010-04-12}}</ref> and one of the best Midwest colleges by ''[[Princeton Review]]''.<ref>[http://www.princetonreview.com/login3.aspx?RDN=1 Best Midwest Colleges], Princeton Review</ref> The University ranked 189th in the US by research expenditure in 2007.<ref>[http://mup.asu.edu/research2009.pdf Top American Research Universities], The center for Measuring University Performance</ref>
The university ranks 98th in the world in the [[College and university rankings|Professional Ranking of World Universities]] conducted by the [[Ãcole des Mines de Paris]] in 2011<ref>[http://www.mines-paristech.fr/Actualites/PR/ Internationl Professional Ranking of Higher Education Institutions], [[Ãcole des Mines de Paris]]</ref> and ranked as one of the top 500 world universities in the [[Academic Ranking of World Universities]] compiled by [[Shanghai Jiao Tong University]].<ref>[http://www.shanghairanking.com/ARWU2011.html Academic Ranking of World Universities, Shahai Jiao Tong University.] Retrieved on Nov 21, 2007.</ref> The [[College and university rankings#SCImago Institutions Rankings|SCImago Institutions Rankings]] rated UW-Milwaukee 759th among 3,042 universities and research institutions worldwide in term of research output, international collaboration, normalized impact and publication rate in 2011.<ref>[http://www.scimagoir.com/ SIR World Report 2011], SCImago Institutions Rankings</ref> The [[Webometrics Ranking of World Universities]] ranked UW-Milwaukee 200th world wide<ref>[http://www.webometrics.info/top12000.asp?offset=150 Webometrics Ranking of World Universities. ] Retrieved on November 21, 2007.</ref> and 96th in North American.<ref>[http://www.webometrics.info/region_usacan.asp?reg=natx Webometrics Ranking of World Universities: US & Cananda]</ref>
==Programs== *'''College of Engineering and Applied Science''' consists of [[civil engineering]], [[electrical engineering]], [[industrial engineering]], [[materials engineering]], [[mechanical engineering]], and [[computer science]] six departments, with 9 faculty members receiving National Science Foundation Career Awards, 3 Wisconsin Distinguished Professors and 3 UWM Distinguished Professors.<ref>[http://www4.uwm.edu/ceas/faculty_research/featured_research/distinct_faculty.cfm CEAS Faculty With Distinction]</ref> The [[University of WisconsinâMilwaukee College of Engineering and Applied Science|College of Engineering and Applied Science]] ranks 129th nationally by ''[[U.S. News & World Report]]'',<ref name="Best Engineering Schools"/> with its [[computer science]] program ranked 110th in 2011.<ref name="Rankings: Computer Science"/> Based on the statistical analysis by H.J. Newton, Professor of Statistics at Texas A&M University in 1997 on the [[United States National Research Council|National Research Council]] report issued in 1995, the school was ranked 73rd nationally in the [[United States National Research Council rankings|National Research Council]] (NRC) rankings,<ref>[http://www.stat.tamu.edu/~jnewton/nrc_rankings/nrc1.html#RANKBYAREA A Brief Summary of the NRC Rankings], Texas A&M University</ref> with its [[Civil Engineering]] program 69th,<ref>[http://www.stat.tamu.edu/~jnewton/nrc_rankings/nrc41.html#area22 NRC Rankings in each of the 41 Areas:] civil engineering, Texas A&M University</ref> [[Electronic Engineering]] 96th,<ref>[http://www.stat.tamu.edu/~jnewton/nrc_rankings/nrc41.html#area23 NRC Rankings in each of the 41 Areas:] Electronic Engineering, Texas A&M University</ref> [[Industrial Engineering]] 34th,<ref>[http://www.stat.tamu.edu/~jnewton/nrc_rankings/nrc41.html#area24 NRC Rankings in each of the 41 Areas:] Industrial Engineering, Texas A&M University</ref> [[Materials science]] 60th,<ref>[http://www.stat.tamu.edu/~jnewton/nrc_rankings/nrc41.html#area25 NRC Rankings in each of the 41 Areas:] Materials science, Texas A&M University</ref> and [[Mechanical Engineering]] 87th.<ref>[http://www.stat.tamu.edu/~jnewton/nrc_rankings/nrc41.html#area26 NRC Rankings in each of the 41 Areas:] Mechanical Engineering, Texas A&M University</ref>
*'''College of Health Sciences ''' is the largest college of [[health sciences]] in the [[Midwest]]<ref>[http://www4.uwm.edu/chs/students/current_students/ College of Health Sciences website]</ref> and it offers the largest number of health-related degree programs in [[Wisconsin]].<ref name="About CHS Facts & Figures"/> The school's [[occupational therapy]] program was ranked 24th nationally by ''[[U.S. News & World Report]]'' in 2008.<ref name="Rankings: Occupational Therapy"/>
*'''College of Letters and Science''' offers 40 bachelor degrees, 20 masters and 12 doctoral degrees. Based on the statistical analysis by H.J. Newton, Professor of Statistics at Texas A&M University in 1997 on the [[United States National Research Council|National Research Council]] report issued in 1995, the [[United States National Research Council rankings|National Research Council]] (NRC) rankings rank UW-Milwaukee's [[Anthropology]] program 62nd,<ref>[http://www.stat.tamu.edu/~jnewton/nrc_rankings/nrc41.html#area35 NRC Rankings in each of the 41 Areas:] Anthropology, Texas A&M University</ref> [[Economics]] program 88th,<ref>[http://www.stat.tamu.edu/~jnewton/nrc_rankings/nrc41.html#area36 NRC Rankings in each of the 41 Areas:] Economics, Texas A&M University</ref> [[English language|English]] department 32nd,<ref>[http://www.stat.tamu.edu/~jnewton/nrc_rankings/nrc41.html#area4 NRC Rankings in each of the 41 Areas:] English, Texas A&M University</ref> [[Geosciences]] program 92nd,<ref>[http://www.stat.tamu.edu/~jnewton/nrc_rankings/nrc41.html#area30:] Geosciences, Texas A&M University</ref> [[Geography]] program 31st,<ref>[http://www.stat.tamu.edu/~jnewton/nrc_rankings/nrc41.html#area37 NRC Rankings in each of the 41 Areas:] Geography, Texas A&M University</ref> [[Physics]] program 88th<ref>[http://www.stat.tamu.edu/~jnewton/nrc_rankings/nrc41.html#area33 NRC Rankings in each of the 41 Areas:] Physics, Texas A&M University</ref> and [[Political Science]] program 51st.<ref>[http://www.stat.tamu.edu/~jnewton/nrc_rankings/nrc41.html#area39 NRC Rankings in each of the 41 Areas:] Political Science, Texas A&M University</ref> The [[political science]] department was ranked 81st globally in a study published by ''Political Study Review'' in 2004.<ref>"A Global Ranking of Political Science Departments", Simon Hix , ''Political Studies Review'', 2004, vol. 2, issue 3, pages 293-313</ref> In a study published by the ''Southern Economic Journal'' in 2008, the research productivity of the [[economics]] department was ranked in the top third of the 129 economics doctoral degree-granting institutions in the U.S.<ref>[http://www4.uwm.edu/news/stories/details.cfm?customel_datapageid_11602=661863 Economics research ranking back on top], University of WisconsinâMilwaukee.</ref>
*'''College of Nursing''' is the largest nursing school in [[Wisconsin]], offering bachelor's, master's, and doctoral degrees.<ref name="ReferenceA"/> In addition to the main campus at [[UW-Milwaukee]], the College of Nursing also has a Bachelor of Science in Nursing Program at [[UW-Parkside]] and [[UW-Washington County]].<ref>[http://www4.uwm.edu/nursing/undergrad/bachelor/ Bachelor of Science in Nursing Program], UW-Milwaukee College of Nursing</ref> The College of Nursing was ranked 32nd nationally by ''[[U.S. News & World Report]]'' in 2007.<ref name="ReferenceC"/> It ranked 36th among Schools of Nursing in the US for [[National Institutes of Health]] (NIH) funding.<ref>[http://www.brimr.org/NIH_Awards/2009/NIH_Awards_2009.htm Ranking Tables of NIH funding to Hospitals and Other Health Science Schools],</ref>
*'''Helen Bader School of Social Welfare''' ranked 42nd nationally by ''[[U.S. News & World Report]]'' in 2008<ref name="Social Work Ranked in 2008"/> In March, 2010, Helen Bader School of Social Welfare was awarded the 2010 Academic Excellence Award from the [[American Public Human Services Association]] (APHSA)<ref>[http://www.aphsa.org/Home/Doc/UniversityofWisconsin-MilwaukeeHelenBader2010AcaemicExcellenceAward.pdf] "University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee Helen Bader School of Social Welfare To Receive APHSA 2010 Academic Excellence Award", The American Public Human Services Association</ref><ref>[http://www4.uwm.edu/news/stories/details.cfm?customel_datapageid_11602=3033901 National award to School of Social Welfare], University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee</ref>
*'''Peck School of the Arts''' consists of dance, film, music, theatre, and visual art departments.<ref>[http://www4.uwm.edu/psoa/about/points.html POINTS OF DISTINCTION], University of WisconsinâMilwaukee.</ref> The school also hosts the [[Institute of Visual Art]] (Inova), an internationally known exhibition venue for contemporary art.<ref>[http://www4.uwm.edu/psoa/about/inova_about.html About Inova], Peck School of the Arts</ref> The school was ranked 93rd nationally by ''[[U.S. News and World Report]]'' in 2008.<ref name="Rankings: Fine Arts"/> The school's film program is ranked world top 20 by ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]''.<ref>[http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/25-best-film-schools-rankings-215714 The 25 Best Film Schools Rankings], ''The Hollywood Reporter''</ref>
*'''School of Architecture and Urban Planning''' offers [[bachelor's degree|bachelor]]'s, [[master's degree|master]]'s and [[doctorat|doctoral]] degrees in [[Architecture]] and [[Urban Planning]], with an enrollment of more than 800. The school was ranked among the top twenty by ''[[U.S. News and World Report]]'' in a recent report. The journal ''DesignIntelligence'' in an annual edition of "America's Best Architecture & Design Schools" has also ranked the School of Architecture and Urban Planning among the top twenty and second in the [[Midwest]], as well as tied for third in their âMost Innovative Programsâ category. The Key Center for Architectural Sociology ranked School of Architecture and Urban Planning 18th in research performance among more than 130 schools in [[North America]].<ref>[http://www.uwm.edu/SARUP/prospective/sarupnationalrankhowdowerank.pdf School of Architecture and Urban Planning Ranking], University of WisconsinâMilwaukee, Retrieved on May 27, 2006.</ref>
*'''School of Education''' offers five undergraduate major, five master's, and 12 doctoral programs. It also offers the only four-year interpreter training degree in [[Wisconsin]]. The school was ranked 86th nationally by ''[[U.S. News & World Report]]'' in 2010,<ref name="Rankings:Best Education Programs"/>
*'''School of Information Studies''' offers [[B.S.]], [[Master of Library and Information Science|MLIS]] and [[Doctorate|Doctoral]] programs of [[Information sciences]] The school ranked 16th nationally by the ''[[US News & World Report]]'' in 2007.<ref name="ReferenceB"/> Its Archives and Preservation program was nationally ranked the 9th by ''[[US News & World Report]]'' in 2009.<ref name="grad-schools.usnews.rankingsandreviews.com"/> In 2009, the school was recognized by [[UNESCO]] as one of the "leading international academic institutions" for its "ongoing role in promoting e-government and information ethics initiatives in Africa".<ref>[http://portal.unesco.org/ci/en/ev.php-URL_ID=28431&URL_DO=DO_TOPIC&URL_SECTION=201.html UNESCO implements information ethics and e-government initiative in Africa], UNESCO.ORG</ref><ref name="UN">[http://www4.uwm.edu/news/stories/details.cfm?customel_datapageid_11602=1148629 SOISâs work earns UNESCO praise]</ref>
*'''Sheldon B. Lubar School of Business''' offers bachelor, master and doctoral degrees in a variety of specialities. The school has a total of more than four thousand students enrollment. The Management Information Systems (MIS) program of Sheldon B. Lubar School of Business is ranked 19th in the U.S. and 24th in the world by a study published in Communications for the Association for Information Systems.<ref>[http://www.uwm.edu/Dept/Business/news/releases/0123a2006.html UWM Among Top Universities for MIS Research], Sheldon B. Lubar School of Business. Retrieved on April 15, 2007.</ref> Also, the Organizations and Strategic Management program is ranked 32nd worldwide by a joint study conducted by Texas A&M University and the University of Florida.<ref>http://mays.tamu.edu/mgmt/productivity-rankings/, Sheldon B. Lubar School of Business. Retrieved on March 30, 2009.</ref> In 2006 and 2008, the School was ranked among the top 100 business schools around the world in terms of research productivity.<ref>[http://somweb.utdallas.edu/top100Ranking/searchRanking.php?t=n North American Rankings - Top 100 Ranking - SOM @ UT Dallas<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
*'''School of Public Health''' is a graduate school focusing on [[public health]] research and education. It is one of more than 40 accredited schools of public health in the United States and the first devoted specifically to public health in [[Wisconsin]].<ref>[http://www4.uwm.edu/publichealth/aboutus/10reasons.cfm Top 10 Reasons for SPH at UWM], University of WisconsinâMilwaukee</ref>
*'''School of Freshwater Sciences''' ('''SFS''') is the only graduate school of freshwater science in the U.S. and the third in the world.<ref name="www4.uwm.edu"/><ref name="jsonline.com"/><ref name="nuwireinvestor.com"/> It offers Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) and Master of Science (M.S.) of Freshwater Sciences in Freshwater System Dynamics, Human and Ecosystem Health, Freshwater Technology and Freshwater Economics, Policy and Management.<ref>[http://www4.uwm.edu/freshwater/academics/ School of Freshwater Sciences: Academics]</ref> Located at the edge of the [[Great Lakes]], SFS was built upon the [[Great Lakes WATER Institute]], a freshwater research institution of the [[University of Wisconsin System]] administered by the Graduate School of [[University of WisconsinâMilwaukee]].<ref>[http://www.wisconsin.edu/wisconsinideas/archive/dec1999.pdf Great Lakes Water Institute Gives UW Researchers Unique Access to the Study of F resh Waters], Wisconsin Idea, December 1999, Volume 16, No. 3, Page 5.</ref><ref>[http://www.maritimetrails.org/notes/fall2002/thecrew.asp Organizations and Crew], Wisconsin's Maritime Trails</ref>
